Stratum radiatum.Definition: Layer of the hippocampus lying just superficial to the stratum lucidum in CA3 and the pyramidal cell layer in CA1 and CA2 defined by the the location of CA3 to CA3 associational fibers and the Schaffer collaterals in area CA1.  Adapted from Paxinos, G. The rat central nervous system, 2nd ed, Academic Press, San Diego, 1995, pg. 460)
